description:
Configure a crosshair that follows either the mouse pointer or the hovered point.

In styled mode, the crosshairs are styled in the .highcharts-crosshair, .highcharts-crosshair-thin or .highcharts-xaxis-category classes.

children.name: className
children.description: A class name for the crosshair, especially as a hook for styling.

children.name: color
children.description: The color of the crosshair. Defaults to #cccccc for numeric and datetime axes, and rgba(204,214,235,0.25) for category axes, where the crosshair by default highlights the whole category.

children.name: dashStyle
children.description: The dash style for the crosshair. See plotOptions.series.dashStyle for possible values.

children.name: snap
children.description: Whether the crosshair should snap to the point or follow the pointer independent of points.

children.name: width
children.description: The pixel width of the crosshair. Defaults to 1 for numeric or datetime axes, and for one category width for category axes.

children.name: zIndex
children.description: The Z index of the crosshair. Higher Z indices allow drawing the crosshair on top of the series or behind the grid lines.
